channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Crusaders lift Tū Kōtahi Aotearoa trophy
item.description: The Crusaders have won Super Rugby Aotearoa with a round to spare despite the best efforts of the Highlanders.

item.title: Drunken city brawls 'unacceptable' - Wellington councillor
item.description: A Wellington city councillor wants all options on the table for stopping drunken brawls and violence in the city's nightlife area of Courtenay Place.

item.title: Covid-19: 100 days of no community spread, no new cases reported
item.description: The latest Covid-19 milestone is being described as something to celebrate, but comes with a warning that New Zealand can't afford to let its guard down.

item.title: Kiwi author's debut novel gains instant Hollywood attention
item.description: A New Zealand author who has captured interest worldwide with her debut novel says she drew on her love for the ocean as a major ingredient for the plot.

item.title: Young Kiwi lives teen dream dancing for Lady Gaga
item.description: When Emma-Kate Putnam saw Lady Gaga performing at Auckland's Vector Arena in 2010, she knew she wanted to be on stage with the megastar.

item.title: A new future for Auckland Art Gallery
item.description: The Auckland Art Gallery Toi o Tāmaki has a new advisory committee looking at the future of the gallery as the world changes rapidly around it, with the chair saying the lockdown was a "fantastic opportunity for creativity".

item.title: Auckland reservoirs reach 60 percent capacity
item.description: Auckland reservoirs have reached 60 percent capacity for the first time in months, although the city's reservoirs are usually just under 86 percent full at this time of the year,

item.title: Cyclists don't slow traffic as much as thought - researcher
item.description: Frustrated with bikes slowing traffic? New research from Portland shows cyclists don't usually affect traffic speeds much, even though it may feel like they do.

item.title: Holiday parks expect busier summer than usual due to Covid travel restrictions
item.description: People looking to spend their summer getaway at a holiday park are being told to book sooner rather than later to avoid disappointment.

item.title: New catfish control option to be investigated
item.description: The Bay of Plenty Regional Council has given the goal of eradicating brown bullhead catfish from Lake Rotoiti and Rototua another boost.

item.title: Woman charged after police car stolen, crashed into other cars
item.description: A 42-year-old woman is facing charges after allegedly stealing a police car and then crashing it in Christchurch.

item.title: Person injured after stabbing in East Auckland
item.description: A person is in a stable condition after a stabbing outside a house in the Auckland suburb of Mt Wellington.

item.title: Lebanese community in NZ raising funds for shattered homeland
item.description: Lebanese groups in New Zealand have come together to raise funds to help those affected by the massive explosion which caused devastation in the country's capital, Beirut.

item.title: Food for thought: platform targets stressed hospitality workers
item.description: A not-for-profit offering mental health support to people in the hospitality industry has raised thousands of dollars at its start-up event.

item.title: 'Light' tremor hits centre of country
item.description: People in the northern South Island and southern North Island felt a 4.7 earthquake centred in Marlborough last night.

item.title: Person critically injured after hit-and-run in Waikato
item.description: A person has been airlifted to hospital with critical injuries following a hit-and-run in the western Waikato town of Kawhia early this morning.

item.title: Mosque shooter sentencing: Foreign media told to obey rules
item.description: A senior journalism lecturer is urging the foreign media to respect strict reporting restrictions for the sentencing of the Christchurch mosques gunman.

item.title: Four hours to free critically-injured truck driver after Hawke's Bay crash
item.description: It took nearly four hours to free a critically-injured truck driver after their vehicle careened 10 metres down a bank in Hawke's Bay this morning.
